Bod851.Transcription: Spend and God send alleluiaspare and go bare tristicia
Bod851.Note: A single line in an anthology table of contents.
Bod851.Editions:
Rigg,  A. George. 
             “Medieval Latin Poetic Anthologies (II).” 
             Mediaeval Studies
         40 (1978): 396-409: 405.

BodDou52.Transcription: Spende & god wyl sendespare & euere bare
BodDou52.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die Mittelenglische Sprichwörtersammlung in Douce 52.” 
             Festschrift zum XII Deutschen Neuphilolgentage in München
                1906.
            E. Stollreither, ed. 
         Erlangen (1906): 40-64: 45.

CamGon261.Transcription:
spend and god schal sendespare and ermor carenon penni non
                    warenon catel non carego penni go
CamGon261.Note:
Added by another hand; 5 lines, abbbc, with internal rhyme in the short
                    ‘a’ and ‘c’ lines.
CamGon261.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Gonville
                and Caius College, Cambridge.
         2 vols. Cambridge: at the UP, 1907: 1.317.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 429; 1977, 448.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 57.
Kaiser,  Rolf,
                        ed.  
             Alt- und mittelenglische Anthologie.
         Berlin, 1954; 3rd ed.; trans. as  Medieval English: a
                Old English and Middle English Anthology Berlin West, 1958: 550.
Oliver,  Raymond. 
             Poems Without Names: The English Lyric 1200-1500.
         Berkeley, CA: University of California, 1970: 65.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 558.
Silverstein,  Theodore,

         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 96-7.

Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 114.

RylandsLat394.Transcription: Spende & god woll sendespare & euer bare
RylandsLat394.Note:
Written all on one line; translating ‘Expendas late mittet deus
                        omnia grate / Expensis parce viues par secula parce’, which
                    follows.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 96.
